data.hoverText: 可与单数或复数动词连用的单数名词

data.enText: a large crowd of people, especially one that may become violent or cause trouble

data.chText: 愤怒的 / 失控的暴民
聚集的群众准备猛攻大楼。
data.enText: The mob was/were preparing to storm the building.
mob rule (= a situation in which a mob has control, rather than people in authority)

data.chText: 一群，一帮（有共同点的人）
data.enText: a group of people who are similar in some way
All the usual mob were there.
the people involved in organized crime; the Mafia
a group of strong, often violent people employed to do sth such as protect sb
if a crowd of birds or animals mob another bird or animal, they gather round it and attack it
if a person is mobbed by a crowd of people, the crowd gathers round them in order to see them and try and get their attention

means: 一群，一帮(有共同点的人)

data.enText: a group of strong, often violent people employed to do sth such as protect sb

example: police tried to break up the gang

tr: a loose affiliation of gangsters in charge of organized criminal activities

value.def: A mob is a large, disorganized, and often violent crowd of people.

example.ex: Bottles and cans were hurled on the terraces by the mob...
example.tran: 暴徒向看台扔瓶子和罐子。

example.ex: The inspectors watched a growing mob of demonstrators gathering.
example.tran: 督察们看见越来越多愤怒的示威者聚集到一起。

value.def: People sometimes use the mob to refer in a disapproving way to the majority of people in a country or place, especially when these people are behaving in a violent or uncontrolled way.

example.ex: If they continue like this there is a danger of the mob taking over...
example.tran: 如果他们继续这样下去，就有可能被暴动的群众控制局面。

example.ex: They have been exercising what amounts to mob rule.
example.tran: 他们一直在实行相当于暴政的统治。

value.tran: 大众（含贬义）；（尤指）愤怒暴乱的群众

value.def: You can refer to the people involved in organized crime as the Mob .

example.tran: 这是一宗黑社会犯下的杀人案件。

value.def: If you say that someone is being mobbed by a crowd of people, you mean that the people are trying to talk to them or get near them in an enthusiastic or threatening way.

example.ex: Her car was mobbed by the media...
example.tran: 她的车被媒体团团围住了。

example.ex: They found themselves being mobbed in the street for autographs.
example.tran: 他们发现自己被索要签名的人群围堵在大街上。

trans: 快闪族，快闪党(指通过手机或网络约定突然聚集于某一公共场所的一群人，他们迅速作出某一举动，随后即刻散去)

partsOfSpeech.dec: auto 自己 + mob 动 + ile 属于…的 → 自己动的〔车〕→ 汽车
book 书 + mob 动 + ile 表物体 → 动的书 → 流动图书馆
com 加强 + mot 动 + ion 表动作 → 到处都在动 → 动乱
de 非，相反 + mobilize 动员 → 动员〔退伍〕→ 复员
de 向下 + mot 动 + e → 向下动 → 使降级
e 出 + mot 动 + ion 表名词 → 动出〔感情〕→ 感情
im 不 + mobile 活动的，可动的 → 静止的
loco 地方 + mot 动 + ive 表物 → 从一个地方跑到另一个地方的东西 → 火车头
mobb〔= mob〕动 + ish …的 → 乱动的 → 暴乱的
mob 动 + ster 表人 → 匪徒，歹徒
mob 动 + ile 物体 → 活动的，可动的
mob 动 + ility 性质 →〔人〕动起来 → 能动性
mobil〔e〕活动的，可动的 + ize 使… → 使〔人〕动 → 动员
mot 动 + ion 动作或状态 → 运动
mot 动 + ive 表名词 → 动机
motiv〔e〕动机 + ate 使… → 使有动机 → 推动
pro 向前 + mot 动 + e → 向前运动 → 促进
